posts.post_content:
Flanking creatures with flanking you control have flanking, flanking, flanking, flanking, and flanking. *(Each instance of flanking must be spoken separately.)*  
  
For flank's sake.

Posted By: Salient (1/1/2013 12:10:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Hello, timmies, look at your ninja, now back to [me](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=108903), now back at your [ninja](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=78683), now back to me. Sadly, he isn't me, but if he stopped giving himself +X\*/+X\* and started giving blockers -2/-2, he could smell like me. Look down, back up, where are you? You're on a boat with the man your ninja could smell like. What's in your hand, back at me. I have it, it's an [Indrik Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indrik Umbra) with X\* tickets to the house of pain. Look again, the tickets are now [disfigures](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=180115). Anything is possible when your man smells like Cavalry Master and not bushido. I'm on a horse.  
  
\*Equal to the number of blockers.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Yo dawg, I heard you like Flanking, so we gave your Flanking creatures Flanking, so you can -1/-1 while you -1/-1.  
  
@Test-Subject: Once the blockers are declared, regardless of whether they are removed from combat (because they go to the graveyard due to having 0 toughness, for instance), the attacking creature is still blocked, so no damage will get through unless the attacker also has Trample.
posts.html:
Yo dawg, I heard you like Flanking, so we gave your Flanking creatures Flanking, so you can -1/-1 while you -1/-1.

@Test-Subject: Once the blockers are declared, regardless of whether they are removed from combat (because they go to the graveyard due to having 0 toughness, for instance), the attacking creature is still blocked, so no damage will get through unless the attacker also has Trample.

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (3/4/2010 10:55:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Fun with flanking! (no duh) But seriously, this makes all your turn one sidewinder slivers or mtenda herders effectively 3/3 when blocked.
  
It's really funny, the flavor flaw of flanking: ten billion 1/1's block your Mtenda Herder at once, and they ALL DIE. Turns out being on a horse is better than we give it credit for.
  
Fine with Crib Swap. Good with Mercy Killing. KILLER with Godhead of Awe. BAM.
posts.html:

Fine with Crib Swap. Good with Mercy Killing. KILLER with Godhead of Awe. BAM.

Posted By: KnexWiz (7/22/2012 11:14:59 PM)

posts.post_content:
Each *Time Spiral* card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.  
  
This card is referencing the flanking Knights from *Mirage* as well as the various "lords" like [Goblin King](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin King) by giving flanking Knights their own twist on +1/+1. Possibly also referencing [Zhalfirin Commander](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zhalfirin Commander).
posts.html:
Each Time Spiral card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.

This card is referencing the flanking Knights from Mirage as well as the various "lords" like Goblin King by giving flanking Knights their own twist on +1/+1. Possibly also referencing Zhalfirin Commander.

Posted By: TPmanW (1/23/2012 6:12:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He's a knight. Curves beautifully with the M11 lord. Knights are silly. They've never really been a full Tier 1 deck, cuz they've been just mildly sprinkled throughout Magic's history, but they are probably the number 1 budget deck build a long-time gamer can make.   
  
White Knight -> Paladin En-vec -> Cavalry Master -> Knight Exemplar -> Mirran Crusader...and they just keep getting stupider.  
  
Watch them make this card one day:   
  
playtest name: Ride of the Rohirrim  
  
2WWW  
Sorcery  
  
Knight creatures you control get +2/+2 and trample.   
Flavor text: "Ride for [Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath). Ride for [Ruin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ruin). And the [World](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=World)'s [Ending](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ending)!"
posts.html:
He's a knight. Curves beautifully with the M11 lord. Knights are silly. They've never really been a full Tier 1 deck, cuz they've been just mildly sprinkled throughout Magic's history, but they are probably the number 1 budget deck build a long-time gamer can make.

White Knight -> Paladin En-vec -> Cavalry Master -> Knight Exemplar -> Mirran Crusader...and they just keep getting stupider.

Watch them make this card one day:

playtest name: Ride of the Rohirrim

2WWW
Sorcery

Knight creatures you control get +2/+2 and trample.
Flavor text: "Ride for Wrath. Ride for Ruin. And the World's Ending!"
